definition: courtesy name of Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4]
hole/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for cave dwellings
surname Kong
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)

sentences.english: Locals also lit Kongming lanterns, and sent them into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 當地人還點亮孔明燈，把它們放飛到天空中。

sentences.english: Despite his 2 fruitless visits, Liu Xuande resolved to pay another call on Kongming.
sentences.chinese: 卻說玄德訪孔明兩次不遇，欲再往訪之。

sentences.english: How good a guesser would you have to be to get the sequence EXACTLY correct?
sentences.chinese: 孔明有多好，你必須獲得序列完全正確？

sentences.english: Kongming chess is an intellective game with simple rules but changeable playing measures.
sentences.chinese: 孔明棋是一種玩法簡單，但其中變化無數的益智遊戲。

sentences.english: In recent years, we have produced a number of new varieties, shopping bags and lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 近年，我們又新生產了多個品種，購物袋以及孔明燈。

sentences.english: Xuande said, “however, I wonder if you know where Kongming has gone.”
sentences.chinese: 但不知孔明往何處去了？

sentences.english: Kongming lanterns and hot-air balloons are based on the same principle.
sentences.chinese: 孔明燈和熱氣球，其實是一個原理。

sentences.english: Under Kongming's order, the vessels advanced in single file, their prows pointed west. The crews began to roar and pound their drums.
sentences.chinese: 孔明教把船隻頭西尾東，一帶擺開，就船上擂鼓吶喊。

sentences.english: Kongming borrowed the east wind and the tables had turned.
sentences.chinese: 孔明借來東風，於是局勢逆轉。

sentences.english: Let rise in lanterns and Dai also unique to the region.
sentences.chinese: 放高升和孔明燈也是傣族地區特有的活動。

sentences.english: Tourists launch a Chinese lantern into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 遊客放飛了一隻孔明燈。

sentences.english: When Xuande and Kongming came to Guiyang, Zilong welcomed them into the city.
I want to buy a kongmin light.
Preliminary investigation indicated the fire was caused by firecrackers or Kongming Lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 初步分析認定失火系燃放煙花爆竹或放孔明燈所致。

sentences.english: People release sky lanterns to celebrate the traditional Chinese Sky Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 人們放飛孔明燈來慶祝傳統的中國元宵節。

sentences.english: Oh, I am the second of Kong Ming the master or Einstein the third.
sentences.chinese: 哇，我簡直是孔明第二，愛因斯坦第三。

definition: Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Zhou Yu or Chou Yü (175-210), famous general of the southern Wu kingdom and victor of the battle of Redcliff/in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, absolutely no match for Zhuge Liang

Cao Cao (155-220), famous statesman and general at the end of Han, noted poet and calligrapher, later warlord, founder and first king of Cao Wei 曹魏, father of Emperor Cao Pi 曹丕/the main villain of novel the Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义

Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
two-character surname Zhuge
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Cheng Yu (141-220), advisor to General Cao Cao 曹操 during the Three Kingdoms era
Xun Yu (163-212), brilliant strategist, advisor of Cao Cao in Three Kingdoms
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Sima Yi (179-251), warlord under Cao Cao and subsequently founder of the Jin dynasty
